adjective.description: Cut with care or precision; (of stone) delicately chiselled.
Especially of tobacco: cut so as to be made fine; cut into small pieces.
Cut down to narrow limits; made very fine or small.

noun.description: Originally and chiefly US (A type of) fine-cut tobacco. Now somewhat rare.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in George Chapman (?1560–1634), poet and playwright. From fine + cut.
